questions.question: According to the text, how do platforms like Spotify create hyper-personalized experiences such as the 'Discover Weekly' playlist?
options: By randomly selecting popular items from their catalog.
By only using data from the user's most recent session.
By analyzing large volumes of data including user history, patterns, and comparisons with other users.
By exclusively promoting content from paid sponsors.

questions.question: Personalized recommendation systems only use structured data, like the price of an item, to make suggestions.
Which of the following data types are used by recommendation engines to create a personalized experience? Select all that apply.
options: Your past purchase/listening history
What items you skipped or disliked
Unstructured data like user comments and reviews
Your friends' preferences
The current weather in your city

questions.question: The system operates at high _________, making sure its recommendations are _________-_________ and relevant to what you just watched or liked.
How has Big Data primarily changed the focus of business intelligence?
options: It focuses exclusively on analyzing past sales reports.
It has made data analysis slower but more thorough.
It shifted the focus from historical analysis to a proactive, predictive guidance system.
It eliminated the need for human decision-makers.

questions.question: With Big Data, businesses must wait for a quarter-end report to see how an online ad campaign is performing.
Which of the following are examples of data sources that Big Data allows a business to integrate for better decision-making? Select all that apply.
options: Social media comments
Employee payroll records
Customer support emails
Competitor prices
Touch/click stream data

questions.question: Big Data changes business intelligence from a historical analysis to a guidance system that produces _________ information.
Traditional fraud detection systems were highly effective because their static, rule-based approach was difficult for fraudsters to bypass.
What was a significant limitation of traditional fraud detection mentioned in the text?
options: It required too much computing power.
Analysis was often done in slow, overnight batches, discovering fraud too late.
The rules were too complex for the system to handle.
It could only analyze data from a single country.

questions.question: Big data fraud detection systems train _________ _________ models on tons of historical data to understand what a normal transaction looks like.
According to the text, how does Big Data enhance fraud detection? Select all that apply.
options: By analyzing data in real-time to detect deviations quickly.
By using machine learning to recognize normal patterns and spot anomalies.
By relying on a fixed set of static rules for consistency.
By integrating data from previously siloed databases to see the big picture.
By manually reviewing every single transaction over $100.

questions.question: In transportation and logistics, why is efficiency and optimization so critical?
options: Because there are very few vehicles to manage.
Because profit margins for single units are slim and the business is based on volume.
Because drivers prefer to follow the same route every day.
Because fuel costs are insignificant.

questions.question: The ORION system used by UPS relies solely on historical traffic data to plan routes for the day.
Real-time data from thousands of phones is instantly processed (_________), which is then compared to the massive _________ of historical traffic data to predict route times.
What are the stated benefits of using Big Data for logistics companies like UPS and JD? Select all that apply.
options: Saving fuel
Improving delivery speed
Reducing the number of delivery personnel
Improving customer satisfaction
Reducing costs
